questions.text: Who had thirty-two jokes told about him at the correspondents dinner?
questions.explanation:
Vice President Bob Russell.

	While in Will's old office, he told Toby there had been thirty-two jokes told about Vice President Russell at the correspondents dinner.

questions.text: What agency did Kate work for before she joined the NSC?
questions.explanation:
CIA.

	When Kate told Josh that she had been in a lock down before for seventy-seven hours, Josh figured out that she had been CIA and was at the embassy in Haiti. He told her he had code-word clearance and could find out, but Kate told him he didn't have that kind of code-word clearance.

questions.text: Which staff member was taken down by an agent?
questions.explanation:
Toby.

	After Toby and Will got into an argument about Bob Russell versus Jed Bartlet, Toby decided he couldn't stay in the room any longer and opened the door to go to his office. A Secret Service agent warned Toby to stay in the room and when he tried to leave, the agent knocked him to the ground.

questions.text: What did Doctor Gordon say was the equivalent of Tularemia?
questions.explanation:
Plague.

	While Charlie, Debbie, and President Bartlet were in holding below the White House, Ron Butterfield came to tell them that the threat found was Tularemia.

options: In CJ's flower centerpiece from the dinner
questions.explanation:
Charlie's mail.

	The tularemia was found in one of Charlie's bills that he brought from home.

questions.text: Who said the President got nine laugh-out louds at the correspondence dinner?
questions.explanation:
Josh.

	When Josh and Donna returned from the dinner, Josh wanted to know why his Panama joke was thrown out of the President's speech because it would have gotten him ten laugh-out louds instead of the nine that he was given. Donna looked it up and saw that Commander Harper from the NSC had stricken the line from the speech.

questions.text: Who said, "In the event of a fire, I like to think they'll lock us outside the building."
questions.explanation:
Kate.

	Kate was explaining to Josh the many reasons why the ventilation would be turned off in the building. One reason would be because there was an airborne toxin in the building and the other reason would be smoke from a fire.

questions.text: What shift was Abbey working at the clinic?
options: She wasn't working at the clinic anymore
questions.explanation:
Graveyard.

	Abbey told Leo the reason why she left after the first half of the correspondence dinner was so she could change and get ready for her midnight to eight A.M. shift at the clinic. When Leo mentioned it was the graveyard shift, Abbey said they try not to use that term in front of the patients.

questions.text: Why was Josh's joke about Panama kept out of the President's speech at the correspondence dinner?
options: He forgot to tell anyone the joke
questions.explanation:
The joke was true.

	Josh requested to see Commander Harper about why his Panama joke wasn't in the President's speech. While they were stuck in his office, Kate told him the joke wasn't funny and later told him it was because his joke was true.

Yes.

	After the lock down had been lifted, the President met with Charlie and Debbie in the Mural Room where he told them that it had all been a set up to test the doctors and hazmat team for a time when a real emergency happens. After the others left, Ron Butterfield told the President that tularemia would never get through again.
